definition[0]: behaving or talking in an honest way so that people know what you really think
example[0]: Mo’s very upfront with him about their relationship.
definition[1]: paid before any work has been done or before goods are supplied
definition[2]: if you pay money upfront, you pay it before any work has been done or before any goods are supplied
example[2]: He requires you to pay him upfront.
definition[3]: in football, if you play upfront, you play in a forward position
definition[4]: money that is paid as soon as a deal has been agreed, before any work has been done or any goods have been supplied
example[3]: The company offered an upfront payment of 25% of his first year’s salary.
example[4]: The fund charges a 3.75% upfront sales commission.
